title: Conjunctions, Prepositions And Transitional Adverbs Exercise

questions.question: ……………………….. the girl tried her best, she could not get the first rank.
questions.description: Though is a conjunction use it to introduce a clause.

questions.question: She tried her best …………………………, she could not get the first rank,
questions.description: However is a transitional adverb it cannot connect two clauses use a full stop or a semicolon before however.

questions.question: …………………………. her best efforts, she could not get the first rank.
questions.description: Either despite or in spite of is possible here.

questions.question: …………………………… he ran fast, he did not win the race.
questions.description: Though is a conjunction use it to introduce a clause.

questions.question: ……………………….. running as fast as he could, he did not win the race.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition. It is followed by a noun or ing form.

questions.question: ……………………………. he was ill, he went to work.
questions.description: Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: …………………………… his illness, he went to work.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition it is followed by a noun/ing form.

questions.question: ………………………… I was annoyed, I kept silent.
questions.description: Though is a conjunction use it to introduce a clause.

questions.question: …………………………… she had the required qualifications, she could not get the job.
questions.description: Though is a conjunction use it to introduce a clause.

questions.question: ……………………………… having the required qualifications, she could not get the job.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition it is followed by a noun/ing form.

questions.question: ………………………….. being very rich, she leads a simple life.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition it is followed by a noun/ing form.

questions.question: ……………………….. she is very beautiful, she is not popular.
questions.description: Though is a conjunction it connects two clauses.
